title: Stuck on Authenticating!
body: Ive tried a lot to try and fix it. I tried the firewall fix didnt work. i used hextech didnt work. Id rather not reinstall because it takes forever.

replies.body: So I just found read one of your old comments talking about a vpn. I tried that and it seemed to fix the situation i actually was able to log on ima try to play a game and see what happens. Seems kinda wonky why would it be doing that exactly? From what i understand thats my ISP right not you guys?

A VPN (Virtual Private Network) forces your connection to take a new network path to the servers. Because a VPN bypassed the issue, it means the issue lies between your network and our servers, likely along your ISPs routing. We can capture some data to see what's going on in your route if you run a traceroute log. First, grab a network tool called [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) then plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field before starting the trace. After 5 minutes has passed by, export the results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

Let me know if you encounter issues taking those steps.

I am having the same problem. Both clients authenticate infinitely and the riot boards take a long time to load, but nothing else is slow. Also, this whole problem started when I suddenly got insanely high ping in the middle of a game. Can you tell me what my traceroute says to you? Thanks!

|------------------------------------------------|------|------|------|------|------|------|

|                          172.102.106.86 -    0 |  416 |  416 |    5 |    8 |   26 |   10 |

|   ae1---0.cbr01.lsan.ca.frontiernet.net -    0 |  416 |  416 |    5 |    7 |   35 |    5 |

Finally found a fix through riot support (hextech repair tool)

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367

I have been having EXACTLY the same problem. was in a five man flex ranked game and died because of 500 ping. No internet issues besides riot boards taking FOREVER to load so I restarted LoL. Got back in game and after less than a minute jumped to 230-270 ping. getting desperate, I restart my entire computer, then it wouldn't even let me log in to the client. For the past 2 hours I've been searching riot boards about the issue (very slowly) and I've completely uninstalled and reinstalled LoL and it's still stuck at authenticating.

Ah, I'll be glad to help, but it seems you've run a traceroute using the NA Region test IP. You'll want to rerun this for **5 minutes** using the IP address below:

> **185.40.65.1**

Let me know if you ran into any issues. ^.^

Yeah, definitely looks like some nasty packet loss at the **213.46.177.58** hop. At 94% of packets lost, this specific node is causing most of the problems you're having. I'd strongly recommend reaching out to your ISP's tech support (preferably a tier 2+ agent) and provide them with these traceroute results so they can launch an investigation and resolve this with you.

Let me know if you have any questions.
Still no solution. Still not working. About to uninstall.

still broken?!?!?!
im having the same issue all the sudden.. started this morning.
Is this happening at the login screen? Additionally, is this happening in the Beta Client or Legacy Client?

This occurs on both clients. It gets stuck at authenticating on new client and just logging in on the old client. I have logs idk how to post them though. The only thing i have not done,because i refuse to , is reinstall the game it just takes me litterally 3 days to reinstall and i really dont believe that is the problem. Ive been hearing about this from other friends it just seems like not a lot of people are getting this problem. 2 outta 10 of my friends have this problem. And the last time i was able to play i got all the way into the game and it booted me and i havent been able to get on since that was 2 days ago. When the client updated not to long ago a 56 mb dl i think? thats when i started having the problem the client kept asking me to redownload the patch which i did 3 times upon the 3rd time though like i said i was able to play but i have not been able to log on ever since.
Guys I was having the same issue tried hex repair and all all I had to do was run as administrator. Hope this helps.
